alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Koolau Windward; Olomana (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 16 at 3:36PM HST until January 17 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND THE BIG ISLAND AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A north (340-360 degrees) swell will maintain large surf along north facing shores of most islands tonight. As this swell declines on Wednesday, a west-northwest (300-310 degree) swell will arrive, maintaining large surf along north shores from Kauai to Maui and producing elevated surf along west facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and the Big Island through Thursday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Along north facing shores of windward Big Island, surf of 12 to 20 feet will decline below the advisory level by Wednesday morning. Along northern exposures of windward Oahu, surf of 10 to 15 feet will decline below the advisory level by Wednesday morning. * WHERE...Olomana, Koolau Windward, Big Island East and Big Island North. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island North; Koolau Windward; Olomana
